replies.msg: LIHKG

Generally speaking, airport codes are named after the first three letters of the city in which it is located—ATL for Atlanta, SIN for Singapore, ASU for Asunción, MEX for Mexico City, DEN for Denver; IST for Istanbul; or a combination of the letters in its name, EWR for Newark, GDL for Guadalajara, JNB for Johannesburg, HKG for Hong Kong, SLC for Salt Lake City and WAW for Warsaw. Some airports in the United States retained their NWS codes and simply appended an X at the end, such as LAX for Los Angeles, PDX for Portland, and PHX for Phoenix.[3]

Sometimes the airport code reflects pronunciation, rather than spelling, such as NAN, which reflects the pronunciation of "Nadi" as [ˈnandi] in Fijian, where "d" is realized as the prenasalized stop [ⁿd].

For many reasons, some airport codes do not fit the normal scheme described above. Some airports, for example, cross several municipalities or regions, and mix the letters around, giving rise to DFW for Dallas–Fort Worth, DTW for Detroit–Wayne County, LBA for Leeds Bradford (Airport), MSP for Minneapolis–Saint Paul, and RDU for Raleigh–Durham.

Hong Kong (Great Britain)

replies.msg:
History and conventions
Airport codes arose out of the convenience that it brought pilots for location identification in the 1930s. Initially, pilots in the United States used the two-letter code from the National Weather Service (NWS) for identifying cities. This system became unmanageable for cities and towns without an NWS identifier, thus a three-letter system of airport codes was implemented. This system allowed for 17,576 permutations, assuming all letters can be used in conjunction with each other.

Generally speaking, airport codes are named after the first three letters of the city in which it is located—ATL for Atlanta, SIN for Singapore, ASU for Asunción, MEX for Mexico City, DEN for Denver; IST for Istanbul; or a combination of the letters in its name, EWR for Newark, GDL for Guadalajara, JNB for Johannesburg, HKG for Hong Kong, SLC for Salt Lake City and WAW for Warsaw. Some airports in the United States retained their NWS codes and simply appended an X at the end, such as LAX for Los Angeles, PDX for Portland, and PHX for Phoenix
Cities with multiple airports
In large metropolitan areas, airport codes are often named after the airport itself instead of the city it serves, while another code is reserved which refers to the city itself. For instance:
Beijing (BJS) – Capital (PEK) and Nanyuan (NAY), and the under construction Beijing Daxing International Airport (PKX).

Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IATA_airport_code

replies.msg: 感謝你的認真解答

講起IATA機場code
其實大部分機場code等於城市code
當然有d城市有兩個機場又會有d唔同，有d一樣
所以search機票字眼同訂飛時要注意係買緊去邊個機場，瀨得最多野既應該係成田，羽田
而大阪，首爾，台北呢d香港只有直航佢地其中一個國際機場，就正常都唔會瀨野

唔同既有:
東京TYO=成田NRT同羽田HND
大阪OSA=関西KIX同伊丹ITM
首爾SEL=仁川ICN同金浦GMP
紐約NYC=JFK/EWR/LGA

一樣既有:
台北TPE已經直接係桃園，同時包括左松山TSA
上海SHA都直接係虹橋，包括埋浦東PVG
曼谷BKK直接係Suvxxxxxxxxxx Airport，包括埋廊曼DMK

又有d係得1個民用機場
但city code同airport code唔同
大家search機票用邊個都無分別
例如台中個city code其實係TXG，清泉崗機場係RMQ
札幌SPK，新千歲CTS
北京BJS，首都機場PEK
啟德年代已經用HKG

當然有d城市有兩個機場又會有d唔同，有d一樣
所以search機票字眼同訂飛時要注意係買緊去邊個機場，瀨得最多野既應該係成田，羽田
而大阪，首爾，台北呢d香港只有直航佢地其中一個國際機場，就正常都唔會瀨野

唔同既有:
東京TYO=成田NRT同羽田HND
大阪OSA=関西KIX同伊丹ITM
首爾SEL=仁川ICN同金浦GMP
紐約NYC=JFK/EWR/LGA

一樣既有:
台北TPE已經直接係桃園，同時包括左松山TSA
上海SHA都直接係虹橋，包括埋浦東PVG
曼谷BKK直接係Suvxxxxxxxxxx Airport，包括埋廊曼DMK

又有d係得1個民用機場
但city code同airport code唔同
大家search機票用邊個都無分別
例如台中個city code其實係TXG，清泉崗機場係RMQ
札幌SPK，新千歲CTS
北京BJS，首都機場PEK

replies.msg: 札幌同北京都有兩個民用機場

Hong KonG 就係 HKG
無咁多乜鬼government

香港代表隊嘅簡稱都係HKG
咁除咗 Hong KonG之外真係冇其他解釋

quote.msg:
例如：
- 倫敦希斯路機場（英語：London Heathrow Airport；代碼：LHR ）
L = London
H = Heath
R = row

香港叫HKG 點解釋

replies.msg:
機場編碼分為2種。第1種是旅客經常見到的3位代號，例如：SYD代表悉尼（Sydney)。由國際航空運輸協會（international Air Transport Association, 縮寫IATA)負責分派。

IATA 代碼原意是方便乘客及航空公司職員，憑3位簡單代碼分辨行李或航班，加快登機及行李處理工作。所以很多時都是機場縮寫：例如MEL是墨爾本（Melbourne ）、SFO是三藩市（San Francisco)、BKK是曼谷（Bangkok)、HKG是香港（Hong Kong)等。

不過由於組合有限，往往出現不同機場但相同縮寫情況，使IATA需要修改縮寫。例如布里斯班（Brisbane)機場的3字代碼是BNE而不是BRI，因為BRI是另一個意大利城市巴里（Bari)。

不過並𣎴是全球所有機場都有IATA代碼，因為全球約有5萬個機場，而3位英文字母組合只有26x26x26即17,576個，所以只有較多旅客使用機場才獲得編碼。荒蕪之地的小機場只有用於航空交通管制ICAO的4位代碼，由國際民航組織（international civil Aviation Organization,縮寫ICAO) 負責分派，一般用於空管及飛行計劃上，全球機場編碼都是獨一無二，例如香港的ICAO代碼是VHHH。

quote.msg:
YVR
Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada - Vancouver International
一個Y字都搵唔到

replies.msg:
加拿大全國都是用Y開頭，因為早期無綫電廣播剛興起時，北美地區按照地理劃分成3塊區域，每一塊區域的發射站呼號前都要加上自己區域的一個特定字母。當時美國密西西比河以東地區為W，以西地區為K，而加拿大則是Y。

所以溫哥華是Y後加英文Vancouver 頭尾字母成為YVR，而渥太華機場(Ottawa)用YOW，但多倫多(Toronto)是YYZ，因為YTO當時已被用作多倫多市的通用地區代碼，不能使用。

quote.msg: LAX 呢

replies.msg:
以前機場代碼是以當地氣象站二字代碼命名，當時洛杉磯機場二字代碼是LA。但由於後來二字代碼供不應求，於是機場代碼發展成3字代碼，便在原碼中加入X成為3字代碼。

部分機場亦因未能解決編碼問題，於是加入一個X。例如杜拜（Dubai)不能用DUB，因為與愛爾蘭首都都柏林(Dublin)相同，故在中間換入X成為DXB。
